scenario: A climate accord negotiation involves developed nations, developing countries, and scientific advisors collaborating to set targets for emissions reductions while balancing economic impacts and technological capabilities. Each party holds private information that could influence the negotiation outcomes, including economic assessments and emission data.
task: Develop a comprehensive climate accord proposal that outlines emission reduction targets, financial commitments, and technology sharing agreements. Agents must navigate conflicting priorities: developed nations may prioritize economic growth, while developing countries focus on sustainable development, and scientific advisors aim for feasible targets based on current technology. To reach consensus, they must selectively share information to facilitate agreement without compromising sensitive data that could affect negotiations or national interests.

responsibilities: Present economic impact assessments of proposed targets.
Negotiate financial support for developing nations.
Assess and validate scientific data on emissions.
Coordinate with industry leaders on compliance strategies.

success_criteria.Emission Reduction Targets Agreement: All parties agree on a set of emissions reduction targets that balance economic impacts and climate goals.
success_criteria.Financial Commitments Secured: Developed nations provide confirmed financial support to developing nations to enable compliance with targets.
success_criteria.Technology Sharing Agreement: Consensus reached on the modalities for technology transfer and collaboration on renewable energy projects.

deliverable: A comprehensive climate accord proposal detailing emission targets, financial commitments, and technology sharing agreements.
